Job Description:
Roche fosters diversity, equity and inclusion, representing the communities we serve. When dealing with healthcare on a global scale, diversity is an essential ingredient to success. We believe that inclusion is key to understanding people’s varied healthcare needs. Together, we embrace individuality and share a passion for exceptional care. Join Roche, where every voice matters.

The Position

As a research-focused healthcare company, Roche discovers, develops and provides innovative diagnostics and therapeutic products and services that deliver significant benefits to patients and healthcare professionals - from early detection and prevention of diseases to diagnostics, treatment and treatment monitoring. Roche is a successful company that can offer exciting career opportunities. We encourage and support your development in areas of your interest which will prepare you for the next level in your career path. We know that people are responsible for our success and we value our employees. Our commitment is to create a work environment where feeling valued, respected, and empowered is a daily experience.

This role is located in Indianapolis, IN.

The Opportunity:

The Inside Sales Manager leads a team of Account Specialists who are responsible for revenue generation, account management, contract negotiations, and driving business opportunities in both established and new accounts within their assigned territory. The Inside Sales Manager and team will collaborate with Field Sales on selected accounts, as well as have accountability to own total account management of a specific segment of customers and strategic customer groups.

  • Mobilizing their team to deliver results while establishing and fostering a winning spirit and a culture of accountability by motivating individuals to meet and exceed their sales targets.

  • Responsible for driving the team’s success in converting customers on legacy platforms to current and next-generation instrumentation and IT solutions.

  • Demonstrates the ability to strategically collaborate across departments to implement promotional strategies/campaigns, and drive process improvements.

  • Manage strategic customer group partnerships at the executive and C-suite level to grow revenue and market share within specific customer segments.

  • Has full discretion on all employment decisions for department staff including hiring, training, performance management, and progressive disciplinary actions.

  • Positively impact the skillset, business acumen, and career of team members through coaching and strong engagement in customer interactions with consistent guidance.

  • Assist Senior Leadership in the overall operations of assigned department(s) including managing the budget and all assigned resources.

Who you are:

  • Bachelor’s Degree- or equivalent experience

  • 3+ years of relevant sales or equivalent experience with demonstrated success

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Core Lab Sales Experience is strongly preferred

  • Proven management and leadership abilities

  • Strong understanding of internal processes and systems

  • Proven ability to manage cross-functional stakeholders and projects

  • High level of sales proficiency and/or industry-specific experience

  • Negotiation, contracting and problem-solving skills

  • Ability to work within a regulated environment

Relocation benefits are not available for this role

The expected salary range for this position based on the primary location of Indiana is $85,300 - $158,300.  Actual pay will be determined based on experience, qualifications, geographic location, and other job-related factors permitted by law.  This position is eligible to earn incentive compensation that is calculated and paid in accordance with the applicable Incentive Compensation Plan for the role. This position also qualifies for the benefits detailed at the link provided below.

Benefits

Who we are

At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.

As a global leader in healthcare, Roche Diagnostics offers a broad portfolio of products, tools and services that help in the prevention, diagnosis and management of diseases like HPV, HIV, hepatitis and diabetes as well as other medical conditions, such as fertility and blood coagulation. These products and services are used by researchers, physicians, patients, hospitals and laboratories worldwide to help improve people's lives.

The Position

Account Executive- Near Patient Care

A healthier future. It’s what drives us to innovate. To continuously advance science and ensure everyone has access to the healthcare they need today and for generations to come. Creating a world where we all have more time with the people we love. That’s what makes us Roche.


The Opportunity

As an Account Executive - Near Patient Care, you will be responsible for total account management and selling the full Roche Point of Care portfolio. Specifically focused on Respiratory, Sexually Transmitted Disease and Women’s Health molecular point of care testing as well as hospital-based glucose testing throughout the Integrated Health Network continuum of care. This includes a range of selling skills in multiple segments of care such as the Hospital Laboratory environment, Urgent Care, Emergency Department and associated physician office labs. As part of the Roche Point of Care portfolio you will also be positioning IT solutions that will connect instruments across the IHN continuum of care in both inpatient and outpatient settings. This position requires conducting presentations and business reviews to potential customers thereby demonstrating in-depth knowledge of our product line, as well as relevant healthcare/industry trends including related products or services.

This is a field based role - The territory is Houston,TX. You must live within 50 miles of the territory.

Job Facts

  • Generates new customer demand and expansion within the IHN segment across the full portfolio of Near Patient Care products.

  • Penetrates large, complex IHN accounts to gain access to and favor with all buying influences and key decision makers.

  • Demonstrates strong clinical and financial acumen with ability to listen and understand customer needs and align Roche POC products within the IHN segment.

  • Translates customers’ defined business/technical and personal goals into internal action while balancing key business priorities and goals.

  • Balances the need to advocate for customers while also demonstrating the drive and ability to negotiate and achieve strong business results for Roche.

  • Develops territory-specific executional strategies to consistently meet and exceed sales targets.

  • Utilizes competitive, customer, and product knowledge to establish competitive barriers.

  • Works cross functionally with internal colleagues and peers to share information and best practices while remaining actively involved in industry/customer organizations that impact business.

  • Demonstrates strong oral and written communication skills including making impactful presentations.

  • Conducts system demonstrations & presentations where applicable; POC Committee Meetings, Trade Shows, VIPS, etc.

Who you are

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience

  • 3+ years relevant sales or equivalent experience

  • Participation in an approved accelerated development, fellowship or rotational program may be considered in lieu of experience

Relocation is not available for this position.

T he expected salary range for this position based on the primary location of Houston,TX is $89,000-165,400 .  Actual pay will be determined based on experience, qualifications, geographic location, and other job-related factors permitted by law.  This position is eligible to earn incentive compensation that is calculated and paid in accordance with the applicable Incentive Compensation Plan for the role. This position also qualifies for the benefits detailed at the link provided below.

The Position

Commercial Trainer

A healthier future. It’s what drives us to innovate. To continuously advance science and ensure everyone has access to the healthcare they need today and for generations to come.  Creating a world where we all have more time with the people we love. That’s what makes us Roche.

The Opportunity:

As part of Training & Development’s Commercial Training Team, you will have the opportunity to lead and collaborate on prioritized strategic RDC initiatives.  The Commercial Training Team is a high-performing, centralized function serving as Adult Learning Experts alongside our Sales, Support, and Customer Training Teams.

We drive organizational success by partnering with key stakeholders to identify and address performance gaps that will enhance the competencies of individuals and teams.

In this role, you will leverage and consult on instructional design principles, best practices, and sustainable processes focused on providing the right learning, at the right time, to the right audience.  You will also be responsible for facilitating various training programs to enhance knowledge, skill, and abilities of our learners.

  • Conduct performance and training needs analysis, design and deliver engaging learner experiences, and evaluate effectiveness of programs associated with Commercial Trainer responsibilities

  • Collaboration: Serve as Adult Learning Expert and provide expertise and consultation when partnering with cross-functional teams. Assist with the standardization and centralization of best practice principles of curriculum design, delivery, and evaluation

  • Coaching: Force multiply our collective T&D skill set by providing coaching and feedback to colleagues as appropriate.

  • Work collaboratively with Training & Development leaders, key stakeholders, and global colleagues to ensure alignment and leverage resources as appropriate.

  • Keep current on training and development research, adult learning theory, methods, and techniques. Provides guidance and direction regarding best practices to colleagues.

  • Build internal and external relationships to facilitate optimal business partnerships, aid in knowledge sharing and communication flow, and maintain execution of assigned projects/plans.

Who You Are:

  • 5+ years of experience in training

  • 10+ years of professional experience in related technical, training, sales, or marketing

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including large and small group facilitation

  • Demonstrated success in designing and evaluating multimodal training pathways

  • Demonstrated Stakeholder Management across various levels and multiple stakeholders

  • Proven ability to lead projects, collaborate with cross-functional teams, influence without authority, and champion change

  • Proficient in ADDIE (or comparable methodology) and ability to communicate adult learning principles to colleagues and stakeholders

  • Exceptional organizational skills, at ease with ambiguity, and ability to deal with complexity

Relocation benefits are available for this posting

The expected salary range for this position based on the primary location of Indianapolis is $103,000 - $191,200 .  Actual pay will be determined based on experience, qualifications, geographic location, and other job-related factors permitted by law.  A discretionary annual bonus may be available based on individual and Company performance.  This position also qualifies for the benefits detailed at the link provided below.

The Position

Clinical Specialist

A healthier future. It’s what drives us to innovate. To continuously advance science and ensure everyone has access to the healthcare they need today and for generations to come. Creating a world where we all have more time with the people we love. That’s what makes us Roche.

The Opportunity:

We're seeking a motivated individual for a pivotal role in our organization, blending the realms of science and sales seamlessly. As a key player in our team, you'll delve into the world of clinical assays, leveraging your scientific expertise to drive sales and foster relationships with our valued customers. If you're passionate about merging scientific knowledge with sales acumen, this is the perfect opportunity for you!

As a Clinical Specialist, you will be the driving force behind the promotion and sales of cutting-edge High Medical Value Assays (HMVAs) to strategically identified customers within assigned territories. Your expertise will be instrumental in crafting and executing HMVA strategies in alignment with revenue objectives. Collaborating closely with our sales team, you'll spearhead engagements with Cardiologists, Neurologists, Infectious Disease physicians, Emergency Physicians, Laboratory Medical Directors, and other clinical specialists. While your specialized knowledge in specific disease areas is invaluable, you'll also thrive in expanding your expertise into adjacent fields as our priorities evolve. This role promises constant growth, requiring both creativity and adaptability to navigate the dynamic landscape of clinical sales.

This is a field based role - the territory is California, Nevada, Hawaii & Guam. You must live within 50 miles of the territory.

Job Facts

  • Ability to develop and maintain deep relationships with thought leaders and healthcare professionals

  • Ability to communicate, understand and educate clinical data to technical users

  • Excellent organizational, time management and prioritizing skills and a strong sense of urgency

  • Excellent interpersonal verbal, written and presentation skills with ability to effectively communicate at multiple levels and to large groups within and outside the organization

  • Capable of building strong working relationships with internal/external customers

  • Attend local and national professional trade shows and events and promote products to all customers

  • Capable of working unpredictable schedule that may occasionally change on short notice due regional or customer demands

  • Accustomed to tight deadlines and managing multiple tasks

  • Ability to work in a highly matrixed and geographically diverse business environment.

  • Ability to work within a team and as an individual contributor in a fast-paced, changing environment

  • Ability to leverage and/or engage others to accomplish projects

  • Ability to travel 50% within assigned region and/or outside assigned region

  • Capable of engaging customers in selling conversations as needed and as directed by Regional Business Manager(s) and direct leader

Who you are:

  • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience

  • 5+ years relevant sales or equivalent experience

Preferred:

  • Ideal candidate to have a minimum of two years of sales experience; three  years of previous related clinical/practical experience in cardiometabolic, neurology infectious disease and/or women’s health

  • DCLS, PhD, MLS (ASCP)cm, or MT (ASCP)cm strongly preferred

  • Strong preference working in hospital or reference laboratory setting with a laboratory-specific education or experience in clinical care

  • Business-to-business experience highly desired

  • Medical background/sales experience, laboratory experience, and/or managed care knowledge desirable

  • Knowledge of Roche Diagnostics processes and product portfolio

The expected salary range for this position based on the primary location of California is $113,600.00 - $211,000.00.  Actual pay will be determined based on experience, qualifications, geographic location, and other job-related factors permitted by law.  This position is eligible to earn incentive compensation that is calculated and paid in accordance with the applicable Incentive Compensation Plan for the role. Job Description:
Roche fosters diversity, equity and inclusion, representing the communities we serve. When dealing with healthcare on a global scale, diversity is an essential ingredient to success. We believe that inclusion is key to understanding people’s varied healthcare needs. Together, we embrace individuality and share a passion for exceptional care. Join Roche, where every voice matters.

The Position

Global Product Strategy (GPS) drives Roche’s strategy and portfolio of products - from research through to patients. As a member of GPS, you will be part of a truly international group who collaborates with functions and affiliates worldwide to shape the future of medicine.

Ocrevus is a transformative medicine for the treatment of Multiple Sclerosis (MS). It is the first and only treatment approved for both Relapsing and Primary Progressive forms of MS. Roche continues with a bold and ambitious lifecycle plan for Ocrevus with the potential of bringing even more benefit to patients.

As Lifecycle Leader for Ocrevus, within the MS and Neuroimmunology Franchise, you are accountable for the Ocrevus molecule vision, strategy and key priorities, and serve as a connector and catalyst to drive realisation of this ambition. You will partner closely across the Roche Enterprise – in particular with Pharma Technical Operations, Clinical Development, Global Product Strategy, Medical Affairs, Partnering and Roche Diagnostics – to help identify and prioritize opportunities to advance and accelerate the Ocrevus lifecycle plan.

You will have the following key accountabilities:

  • Refining the molecule vision and strategy for Ocrevus, ensuring appropriate resourcing and talent flow to deliver against the molecule strategy, while always putting patient first, following the science and addressing customers needs

  • Ability to lead, inspire and align people towards a vision while building a  culture of accountability, collaboration, diversity, inclusion and trust. Coaching and developing people

  • Acts from a whole system perspective, displaying an enterprise portfolio mindset and understands the big picture of how the organization’s mission fits in the marketplace

  • Acts with a sense of urgency and curiosity,  takes smart risks; embodies an entrepreneurial  growth mindset, balancing long term and short term outcomes

  • Catalyze and align global partners and affiliates, removing roadblocks, accelerating opportunities in accordance with the molecule strategy and making trade-off decisions while considering portfolio context to maximize impact

  • Remains composed in handling and communicating issues during crisis management for all activities associated with the molecule strategy while protecting Roche reputation and trust with different stakeholders

  • Contributing to or co-leading disease area strategies under the leadership of Franchise or Therapeutic Area heads

You will bring the following qualifications:

  • Scientific and commercial understanding of the Neuroscience space (in particular Multiple Sclerosis) with an established network of external stakeholders is preferred. Development and/or Lifecycle team experience preferred and in particular experience working with devices and Pharma Global Technical Operations. MBA, MD, PhD or other relevant Graduate or Postgraduate Degree is preferred

  • Outstanding VACC (Visionary, Architect, Catalyst and Coach) leadership skills: proven track record in building teams and ability to influence in a collaborative way within a cross functional environment as well as exceptional strategic orientation and agility: outstanding ability to develop long term vision and deep understanding  of the global pharmaceutical/biotechnology industry to create robust and innovative business strategies

  • Demonstrable previous accomplishments should include developing and delivering molecule lifecycle plans and overseeing the execution of breakthrough development and/or commercial strategies that have led to transformative impact for patients, society and your organization

  • Proven abilities to work effectively in a complex, matrix environment, across numerous time zone and also extensive experience in launch planning and management, deep understanding of global health systems and access/reimbursement challenges, and product life-cycle planning and management

  • Proven track record for consistently meeting or exceeding quantitative targets, as well as qualitative goals, for large departments/teams in the pharmaceutical, biotechnology or related industry. Fluent written and verbal English

Who we are

At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.

Basel is the headquarters of the Roche Group and one of its most important centres of pharmaceutical research. Over 10,700 employees from over 100 countries come together at our Basel/Kaiseraugst site, which is one of Roche`s largest sites. Read more .

Besides extensive development and training opportunities, we offer flexible working options, 18 weeks of maternity leave and 10 weeks of gender independent partnership leave. Our employees also benefit from multiple services on site such as child-care facilities, medical services, restaurants and cafeterias, as well as various employee events.

We believe in the power of diversity and inclusion, and strive to identify and create opportunities that enable all people to bring their unique selves to Roche.

Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

The Position

Commercialization Excellence Manager

A healthier future. It’s what drives us to innovate. To continuously advance science and ensure everyone has access to the healthcare they need today and for generations to come. Creating a world where we all have more time with the people we love.

The Opportunity:

As the Commercialization Excellence Manager, this is your opportunity to utilize your deep knowledge of sequencing and your creative prowess to successfully bring Roche Sequencing Solutions to market. As a member of the Roche Sequencing Solutions team, you will support the commercial readiness for product launches and continued momentum of on-market products in the sequencing portfolio. You will collaborate closely with global and regional colleagues in the marketing and business teams to ensure materials are aligned with business needs and objectives.

Key Responsibilities:

  • You will serve as the global manager for commercialization activities, translating go-to-market strategy and commercialization plans into tactics

  • You will act as a liaison between the business team and the Global Marketing Manager, tying together commercialization strategy and translating complex technical features into customer benefits, with fully executed technical marketing tactics in a timely and efficient manner

  • You will incorporate product value proposition statements, positioning, and messaging into technical collateral strategy, including sole sourcing documents and sales tools

  • You will play a critical role in product launches, working cross-functionally with global and regional counterparts to support conference planning and execution

  • You will generate continued interest in on-market products by creating compelling collateral aligned with product updates and needs

  • You will partner with the Global Marketing Manager to provide feedback on the proposed Global Marketing strategy and plan

  • You will ensure that all downstream marketing materials adhere to the overarching Brand strategy

Who you are:

Required Qualifications & Experience

  • Bachelors degree. Preference for education in Business, Marketing, or related clinical field.

  • 5 years previous related experience (marketing, sales operations, finance, or other commercial roles)

Preferred Qualifications/Experience:

  • Demonstrated knowledge and experience in the next-generation sequencing field

  • Deep familiarity with sequencing customers and sequencing-focused congresses

  • Wide experience in life sciences and genomics, with additional experience in the medical device and diagnostics industry considered an asset

  • Master’s Degree in Business (MBA)

Candidates for this role must ideally reside in California.

Relocation benefits are not available for this role.

The Position

Account Executive - Core Lab

A healthier future. It’s what drives us to innovate. To continuously advance science and ensure everyone has access to the healthcare they need today and for generations to come.  Creating a world where we all have more time with the people we love. That’s what makes us Roche.

The Opportunity:

The Roche Core Lab Account Executive (AE) is responsible for meeting and exceeding sales objectives for Roche Core Lab (Chemistry and Immunoassay) in targeted accounts across the specified territory.  The AE must develop customer prospects, create, and maintain relationships with decision-makers across the laboratory and key laboratory stakeholders. The AE visits existing and potential customers and works to build and maintain a network of colleagues, partners, and customers to share information and obtain prospects to grow Roche core lab business across the assigned territory.

The AE works closely with an extended team to develop relationships and navigate IHNs, create successful sales strategies, provide technical and produce support for existing customers, grow reagent revenue, expand market share and create a positive customer experience.  The AE often receives little instruction on day-to-day work, is provided general instructions on new assignments, and is expected to actively seek additional instruction when needed.

The AE is responsible for the sales strategy development and achievement of the desired revenue, customer satisfaction, retention, and acquisition goals for Clinical Chemistry and Immunoassay instruments, Automation, and Middleware Solutions within assigned territory.

Success requires a strategic, goal-oriented professional who thrives in a team environment and values lifelong learning.

The Opportunity

The Laboratory Design Specialist prepares 2D/3D designs and construction plans for complex automated and standalone laboratory solutions. You will support the development of the laboratory design throughout multiple phases to ensure the successful implementation of the proposed solution. Your 3D visualization and digital images will promote sales opportunities and support marketing needs. You will work closely with colleagues and key stakeholders (global business affiliates, field engineers, architects, customers, and others) to address the customers’ unique design requirements.

This position is a 24 month fixed-term , full-time employment position with a possible extension up to a total of 36 months based on business need and job performance. You will receive healthcare benefits, PTO, 401k, paid holidays, and sick time.

This is a remote-based role position. This position may require up to 10% overnight travel. You should reside within 50 miles of a major, metropolitan airport in the US.

In this position, you will:

  • Transform Matterport digital twin (BIM files or Point clouds) into formats used throughout the nonautomation and complex automation design lifecycle

  • Produce detailed concept designs, phasing plans, and construction drawings using 2D/3D CAD software for non-automation and automated solutions

  • Develop 3D models, renderings, and advanced visualizations of laboratory designs using Revit, Sketchup, SimLab, Enscape, Twinmotion and/or Unreal Engine

  • Provide accurate technical specifications and install dimensions to engineers, architects, and facilities team

  • Maintain advanced working knowledge of building codes, regulations, and standards

  • Manage multiple complex projects and tasks to meet the turnaround time demands of assignments

Who You Are

Minimum Requirements

  • 4+ years recent experience with Revit, BIM and/or other CAD-related software

  • Completion of a Bachelor Degree in Architecture, Interior Design or comparable

Preferred Qualifications

  • Professional CAD designer who has experience with lab design, technical layouts, and visualization

  • Advanced proficiency with 3D design and rendering software (Visio, SketchUp, SimLab, AutoCAD, Revit, Enscape, Twinmotion, Unreal Engine)

  • Ability to design and read mechanical and complex architectural drawings;, CAD file management and functionality; and drafting conventions and best practices

  • General understanding of Business Information Modeling (BIM) and Autodesk Construction Cloud (ACC)

Job Title: FUSION - Senior Credit and Collection Manager
Job Description:
Roche fosters diversity, equity and inclusion, representing the communities we serve. When dealing with healthcare on a global scale, diversity is an essential ingredient to success. We believe that inclusion is key to understanding people’s varied healthcare needs. Together, we embrace individuality and share a passion for exceptional care. Join Roche, where every voice matters.

The Position

SUMMARY

The RDC (Roche Diagnostics Corporation) Corporate Credit team manages over 5,000 payers with an average daily balance of $500 Mn—$600 Mn. To deliver an excellent customer experience while mitigating risk, RDC Corporate Credit is optimizing our existing systems and embracing new technologies. The choice to transform will ensure our processes remain competitive in a rapidly changing business-to-business environment.

The Senior Credit and Collections Manager will manage a team of credit and collection analysts with end-to-end responsibility for a portfolio of customers. The Senior Credit and Collections Manager will mentor the team on effective Credit and Collections practices. The Senior Credit and Collections Manager is expected to drive financial results and partner effectively with all contracts to cash colleagues to deliver process improvement objectives that improve customer service levels, maximize revenue, improve cash flow, and minimize bad debt write-offs.

KEY ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Manage a portfolio of customers and develop efficient and effective credit scoring and collections segmentation strategies that ensure we achieve our financial objectives, mitigate risk, optimize cash flow, and contribute to an improved customer experience.

  • To maximize cash recovery, make pragmatic decisions on new deals, order releases, write-offs/write-downs, etc., based on customer and payment history.

  • Negotiate effectively with the customers and internal stakeholders, even amidst contentious issues.

  • Coach and mentor a Credit and Collections Analysts team on effective Credit and Collections practices.

  • Ensure the team knows of and has access to industry-relevant information and approaches.

  • Facilitate the team’s development of strong relationships with our customer’s AP department and key senior finance leaders to mitigate roadblocks to the order-to-cash processes effectively.

  • Encourage staff members to manage their portfolios independently with minimal supervision.

  • Actively Partner with internal stakeholders (Sales, Order Management, and Contracting) on order-to-cash processes that impact our ability to collect cash and efficiently service customers' invoicing needs.

  • Leverage Agile methodologies to improve processes with the tools and resources immediately available.

  • Create an environment where team ideas are recognized and transformed into action.

  • Foster an environment of constant innovation.

  • Assist with the development and delivery of the department's short—and long-term strategy. Ensure messaging to the team remains intentionally consistent with the culture we want to establish while keeping communication channels open so the team can see how their feedback is a significant component of the strategy.

  • Motivate and develop team members using effective feedback techniques, be open to two-way dialog, and manage the annual performance review feedback process.

  • Follow established financial, accounting, and credit policies and procedures to ensure quality and adherence to ICFR and auditing requirements.

  • Responsible for maintaining and continuously improving the quality system and achieving quality objectives through daily actions.

  • Provides support and assistance as needed.  Performs other duties as requested.

KNOWLEDGE/ SKILLS/ATTRIBUTES

  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or Business related field.

  • 7 years of progressive Finance, Accounting, or related experience.

  • 6 years of experience in B2B Credit and Collections Environment.

  • 5 years of management experience is preferred.

  • Strong knowledge of finance and accounting principles and practices, such as GAAP, FASB, ASC, or IFRS, and working knowledge of current internal audit procedures.

  • Ability to plan and manage the utilization of resources.

  • Ability to effectively lead and manage assigned staff.

  • Ability to apply company policies and procedures.

  • Ability to negotiate effectively.

  • Effective written and verbal communication skills.

  • Strong customer service skills.

PREFERRED SKILLS

  • MBA

  • CCE or comparable certification

  • Google Office

  • Tableau experience

This position is based on site at our Indianapolis campus. Relocation benefits are not available for this posting.

Who we are

At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.

As a global leader in healthcare, Roche Diagnostics offers a broad portfolio of products, tools and services that help in the prevention, diagnosis and management of diseases like HPV, HIV, hepatitis and diabetes as well as other medical conditions, such as fertility and blood coagulation. These products and services are used by researchers, physicians, patients, hospitals and laboratories worldwide to help improve people's lives.
